dialogue.speaker: LEADER
dialogue.context: Terminator stops right in front of them.
dialogue.utterance: Nice night for a walk, eh?
dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR
dialogue.context: They surround him, all swagger and malign good humor.
dialogue.utterance: Nice night for a walk.
dialogue.speaker: SECOND PUNK
dialogue.context: Terminator eyes them without expression, unhurried. Reptilian.
dialogue.utterance: Washday tomorrow, huh? Nothing clean, right?
dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR
dialogue.utterance: Nothing clean. Right.
dialogue.speaker: LEADER
dialogue.context: Terminator turn to the second punk, ignoring the others.
dialogue.utterance: This guy's a couple bricks short.
dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR
dialogue.context: The punks exchange glances, dismayed.
dialogue.utterance: Your clothes. Give them to me.
dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR
dialogue.utterance: Now.

dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: What day is it? The date...
dialogue.speaker: COP
dialogue.utterance: Thursday...uh...May twelfth.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: A SHOT whines off the metal side of an escalator behind Reese's head. He vaults the escalator rail, leaving the amazed cop lying on the floor. Reese bounds up the frozen steps, pocketing the .38 Police Special in his coat. Cops dash through the maze of aisles, converging at the escalators.
dialogue.utterance: What year?

dialogue.speaker: BREEN
dialogue.context: She answers the empty hallway.
dialogue.utterance: Sarah?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Yes, Chuck?
dialogue.speaker: BREEN
dialogue.context: She turns back toward the office door at the end of the corridor.
dialogue.utterance: Come to the office, please.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Mission control to Chuck, come in...
dialogue.speaker: BREEN
dialogue.context: Sarah is undaunted.
dialogue.utterance: You're late.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Aren't I worth waiting for?
dialogue.speaker: BREEN
dialogue.utterance: Not really. Do you think you can get here on time if I put you on the floor as a waitress?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: I don't know. I kinda had my heart set on being a cashier the rest of my life.
dialogue.speaker: BREEN
dialogue.utterance: The pay's the same but you'll make more in tips.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Breen turns to punch up a display on the restaurant's small accounting computer. Sarah looks over his shoulder as he modifies the week's schedule.
dialogue.utterance: Thanks, Chuck. I need the money. Can I still work the hours around my classes?
dialogue.speaker: BREEN
dialogue.utterance: Mmm. Same schedule's okay.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Alright!
dialogue.speaker: BREEN
dialogue.utterance: Can you handle it?

dialogue.context: Breen hands her an apron ceremoniously.
dialogue.utterance: It's not brain surgery, Chuck.
dialogue.speaker: BREEN
dialogue.utterance: Here you go. You're a Bob's Girl now. Nancy will check you out.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: I won't let the fat kid down.

dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR
dialogue.context: WIDE as the CLERK, who looks like a sick lizard, pallid and paunchy, takes the rifle from a wall rack. He lays it beside the arsenal of perfectly legal anti-human artillery already on the glass counter. Terminator scans expressionlessly for additional selec- tions.
dialogue.utterance: ...the Remington 1100 Autoloader...

dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR

dialogue.utterance: The Uzi 9 millimeter.

dialogue.speaker: CLERK

dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR
dialogue.context: The clerk digs deep and finds a scrap of a smile.
dialogue.utterance: All.

dialogue.utterance: Maybe I'll close early. Cash or charge?

dialogue.utterance: Sorry, I can't sell the ammo with the guns. You'll have to---Hey!
dialogue.speaker: CLERK
dialogue.utterance: You can't to that...
dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR

dialogue.utterance: Miss, we're ready to order.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: As she cleans up the spill, a kid at the next booth reaches over and dumps a scoop of ice cream into the top pouch of Sarah's apron She stares down at the mess melting over her hard-earned and sags with defeat. NANCY, a plump, gum-chewing waitress, stops beside her to whisper.
dialogue.utterance: Oh, sorry. That's not real leather, is it?
dialogue.speaker: NANCY

dialogue.utterance: Sarah Connor?

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN

dialogue.context: I mean sort of...Come on!

dialogue.utterance: Hey, Sarah. This is weird.

dialogue.context: As the news grinds on, Sarah gazes unseeingly at the screen. Nancy claps her on the shoulder, laughing.

Once again, Sarah Connor, thirty-five, mother of two, brutally shot to death in her home this afternoon.

dialogue.context: You're cute. Cute I remember.

dialogue.utterance: I'm Sarah. Ginger's roommate.

dialogue.context: The group collapses ensemble. A chorus of groans.
dialogue.utterance: ...and three aaand four! And that's it ladies! Now, didn't that feel good?
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.context: Ginger walks over to Sarah as the class disperses. Marco is leaning on the wall next to Sarah, who is enjoying the attention.
dialogue.utterance: Let's think positive or next time I'll play the FM version.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Before Marco can reply, Ginger pulls the front of his gym shorts out and peers down. She shakes her head.
dialogue.utterance: ...yeah, really? Say some- thing in Italian.
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.context: She grabs Sarah by the arm and pulls her out the door. Sarah catches a glimpse of Marco's expression over her shoulder as the door closes.
dialogue.utterance: You're wasting your time, kiddo. Let's go.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: I could tell.
dialogue.utterance: I had him hooked. He was just about to ask me out.
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.utterance: That guy's a jerk. I did you a favor.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Sarah laughs and claps her friend on the back. They turn in at a door marked WEIGHT ROOM.
dialogue.utterance: I'll do the same for you sometime.

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.context: Matt opens his eyes.
dialogue.utterance: What's this? Sleep therapy?
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.utterance: You think somebody's gonna do this for you? Look at those shriveled bi's. And you haven't worked lat's or ab's since Wednesday.
dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.utterance: Hello, sweetheart. Had a rough day?
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.context: She leans down as he sits up and they meet in a kiss that's bad for the other guys' discipline. Sarah waits until they break the clinch to speak.
dialogue.utterance: Come here, wimp.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Matt look backwards over the bench, and replies, upside-down.
dialogue.utterance: Hi, Matt.
dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.context: Ginger pulls the pin on Mat's weights and re-inserts it beneath the entire stack, the maximum weight.
dialogue.utterance: Heeey! It's my favorite Sarah. Hi, babe.
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.context: Ginger readadjusts her headphones as the two girls walk away.
dialogue.utterance: Alright, warm-ups are over. Back to work, Bunky.

dialogue.context: Two weightlifters nearby look at each other, than at Matt.
dialogue.utterance: 'Bye beautiful. You too, Ginger.
dialogue.speaker: WEIGHTLIFTER
dialogue.utterance: Bunky?

dialogue.speaker: SISTER
dialogue.context: The boy rides past her list a shot.
dialogue.utterance: See, I told you he wasn't dead. You owe me Baskin Robbins.
dialogue.speaker: BOY
dialogue.utterance: Come on. Just come on.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Hello?
dialogue.speaker: VOICE
dialogue.context: Sarah cups her hand over the mouthpiece and calls out matter-of-factly:
dialogue.utterance: First I'm going to rip the buttons off your blouse, one by one...then run my tongue along your neck, down to your bare, gleaming breasts...
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: She resumes listening.
dialogue.utterance: Ginger! It's Matt.
dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.context: Sarah is repressing laughter.
dialogue.utterance: ...and then slowly pull your jeans off inch by inch and lick your belly in circles, further and further down... then I'll pull off your panties with my teeth...
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Silence. Then Matt realizes to his horror who he's been talking to.
dialogue.utterance: Who is this?
dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.utterance: Oh my God! Sarah! Oh, shit. Jesus, I'm sorry. I thought you were...Can I talk to Ginger?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: As Ginger approaches, Sarah hands her the receiver and goes into the bedroom.
dialogue.utterance: Sure, Bunky.
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.utterance: Hello?
dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.utterance: First I'm gonna rip the buttons off your blouse...

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: What do you think?
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.context: Sarah hold up another one.
dialogue.utterance: Great.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: How about this?
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.utterance: Great.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: You're a big help.
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.utterance: Alright, the beige one.

dialogue.utterance: I hate the beige one.

dialogue.utterance: Don't wear the beige one.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: A couple of BEATS, and she's back in the doorway with a concerned expression.
dialogue.utterance: This guy's probably a schmuck and I don't care what I wear.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: You think the beige?

dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.utterance: Give me the short version.
dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.utterance: Six shots at less than ten feet. Weapon was a large caliber-- Vukovich is looking at the body.
dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.context: Traxler turns to a passing DETECTIVE.
dialogue.utterance: No shit.
dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.context: He turn back to Vukovich, gesturing at the body.
dialogue.utterance: Come on. man. Don't track it all over. It's un- professional.
dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.utterance: Okay, let's see...Got a pos- itive on her. She's Sarah Connor, works as a legal--
dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.context: Traxler slips something off his clipboard and hands it to the Lieutenant.
dialogue.utterance: That can't be right. That's the name of the one Valley Division mopped up this after- noon.
dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.utterance: Here's her driver's license.
dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.utterance: You gotta be kidding me. The new guys'll be short-stroking it over this one. A one-day pattern killer.
dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.utterance: I hate the weird ones.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Ginger enters, stopping beside their phone answering machine.
dialogue.utterance: Ginger, have you seen Pugsley?
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.utterance: Not lately. Did you check messages?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: She checks under the couch, then behind the drapes. She bends down.
dialogue.utterance: I thought you did.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: C.U. - PUGSLEY, as the GREEN IGUANA cocks its head, blinking vapidly. RESUME WIDE, Sarah lifts the three foot long lizard from his perch on the windowsill. She gives the complacent reptile a kiss on its blunt snout.
dialogue.utterance: Come here young man. Mind your mother.
dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.context: Sarah drapes the lizard across her shoulders where it sits contentedly as she looks for her purse. Ginger has been rewinding the message tape. She punches PLAY and a MALE VOICE is heard.
dialogue.utterance: Totally nauseating.
dialogue.speaker: VOICE
dialogue.context: Sarah stands still, crestfallen.
dialogue.utterance: Hi, Sarah...Stan Morsky. Uh, something's come up and it looks like I won't be able to make it tonight. I'm really sorry. Call you in a day or so. Sorry. 'Bye.

dialogue.utterance: That bum. So what if he has a Porsche, he can't treat you like that...it's Friday night for crissakes.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: I'll live.

dialogue.context: Sarah resignedly slips Pugsley off her shoulders.

dialogue.utterance: ...Lieutenant, are you aware that these two killings occurred in the same order as their listings in the phone book?

dialogue.context: He and Traxler enter their office and shut the door.

dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.utterance: That stuff's two hours cold.
dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.utterance: I know.
dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.context: Vukovich, lost in thought, turns on him suddenly.
dialogue.utterance: I put a cigarette out in it.

dialogue.utterance: Did you reach the next girl yet?
dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.utterance: No. Keep getting an answer- ing machine.
dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH

dialogue.utterance: Got a cigarette?

dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.utterance: Same shit.
dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.utterance: I can hear it now, it's gonna be the goddamned 'Phone Book Killer'.
dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.utterance: I hate the press cases. Especially the weird press cases. Where you going?

dialogue.context: He looks at his watch, then straightens his tie.
dialogue.utterance: To make a statement. I'm gonna give them the name. Maybe the jackals can help us out for once.
dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.utterance: If they can get this on the tube by eleven, she may just call us. How do I look?
dialogue.speaker: TRAXLER
dialogue.context: Vukovich goes out and the Minicam light hits him as the door closes.
dialogue.utterance: Like shit, boss.

dialogue.speaker: ANCHORMAN
dialogue.context: CUT WIDE to show Sarah watching the TV which is suspended over the bar. The place is a crowded, post-movie hangout, raucous with laughter and videogames. The newscast continues, ignored by all except Sarah.
dialogue.utterance: ...police had no further comment on the apparent similarity between the shooting death of an Encino woman earlier today...

dialogue.context: A customer gestures for the bartender's attention.

dialogue.utterance: Hey, can we change this and catch the ball scores.

dialogue.utterance: Leave it where it is!

dialogue.utterance: ...no other connections between the two victims has been estab- lished. On a lighter note, these was cause for celebration at the L.A. Zoo today, as...

dialogue.speaker: GINGER'S VOICE
dialogue.context: C.U. - TERMINATOR, motionless, listening.
dialogue.utterance: Hi there. Ha ha ha, fooled you. You're talking to a machine...

dialogue.utterance: ...but don't be shy, it's okay. Machines need love too...
dialogue.speaker: GINGER'S VOICE
dialogue.context: There is a loud tone and the incoming call is heard.
dialogue.utterance: ...so talk to it and Ginger, that's me, or Sarah will get back to you. Wait for the beep.

dialogue.context: Terminator's head snaps back and he freezes, listening. He rises slowly as Sarah's voice continues.

dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.context: He hangs up and grabs his coat, motioning to Traxler.

dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH

dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.context: He heads for the inferno at a run.

dialogue.speaker: VUKOVICH
dialogue.utterance: Go! Go! He's got her.

dialogue.utterance: Suspect westbound on Olympic. Grey sedan. Has hostage, repeat...

dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: He reaches over and runs his hands over her arms, legs, chest. Sarah flinches. She feels the BLIND PANIC BOILING UP WITHIN HER. She pushes his hand away and opens the door. Reese slams her back in the seat and slaps her. Hard.
dialogue.utterance: Are you injured? Are you shot? No response.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: As he speaks he is locking the door and fastening Sarah's seatbelt over her, cinching it very tightly, like you would for a child. She doesn't answer.
dialogue.utterance: Do exactly what I say. Exactly. Don't move un- less I say. Don't make a sound unless I say. Do you understand?
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Do you understand?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Yes. Don't hurt me.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: Sarah stares numbly at his outstretched hand. With zero strength she automatically returns his handshake.
dialogue.utterance: I'm here to help you. Reese, Sergeant/Tech-Com, DN38416...
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Assigned to protect you. You've been targetted for termination.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: This is a mistake. I haven't done anything.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: Sarah closes her eyes, as if to shut it all out.
dialogue.utterance: No. But you will. It's very important that you live.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Reese's tone is equal parts hatred and respect as he replies.
dialogue.utterance: I can't believe this is happen- ing. How could than man get up after you...
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: Cyber Dynamics Model 101.
dialogue.utterance: Not a man. A Terminator.

dialogue.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogue.utterance: ...Suspect vehicle sighted on Motor at Pico, southbound. Units Two-Zero-Six and Five- Seven, attempt intercept. Unit One-Four-Three, come in. Terminator picks up the mike. He speaks in a simulation of the young cop's southern twang.
dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR
dialogue.utterance: This is One-Four-Three. West- bound on Olympic, approaching Overland.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: A machine? You mean, like a robot?
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: They have to yell over the roar of air through the broken windshield.
dialogue.utterance: Not a robot. Cyborg. Cybernetic Organism.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: At that moment a blinding light sears down on them from above. Reese looks over his left shoulder and sees a CHP cruiser coming alongside.
dialogue.utterance: But...he was bleeding.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Just a second. Keep your head down.

dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: But outside, it's living human tissue. Flesh, skin, hair...blood. Grown for the cyborgs.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Look, Reese, I know you want to help, but...

dialogue.utterance: Pay attention. The 600 series had rubber skin. We spotted them easy. But these are new. They look human. Sweat, bad breath, everything. Very hard to spot. I had to wait 'til he moved on you before I could zero him.

dialogue.context: He touches the grass, the trunk of a tree.
dialogue.utterance: It's...like some dream. This...this...
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: He looks are her beseechingly.
dialogue.utterance: ...and you...all so...beauti- ful. It hurts, Sarah. More than death.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: She sniffs and wipes at her nose with the back of her hand.
dialogue.utterance: Don't you understand...it's all gone! Sarah puts her arm around him.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: She takes his shoulder in her hands.
dialogue.utterance: We can change it, Kyle. We have to try.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: He picks up her sign and they look at each other for a second, then get up.
dialogue.utterance: There's no fate but what we make for ourselves. Right? Come on. Let's go, kiddo. Whaddya say?

dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Is this enough?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: She turns to the desk clerk, a female version of the pawn- shop lizard.
dialogue.utterance: Yes. And I don't want to know where you got it.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: We need a room...with a kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: I'm dying for a shower. You could use one too. And we'd better check that bandage.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: He hands her the .38 he took off the detective. She takes it without thinking as he leaves then realizes that she has A LOADED GUN IN HER HAND, without the slightest idea of how to use it. She lays it gently on the dresser. As an afterthought, she turns it with one finger so that it is pointing the other way. Sarah moves the curtain slightly and looks outside.
dialogue.utterance: Later. I'm going out for materiel. Keep this.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: ...No, Mom, I can't tell you where I am. I was told not to say.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH'S MOM
dialogue.context: Sarah hesitates, then:
dialogue.utterance: But honey, I need to know where I can reach you or I'll be worried sick. It turns out I can't stay up here...the electricity's off...and I don't know just where I'll be.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Okay, here's the number. Are you ready?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH'S MOM
dialogue.utterance: Go ahead.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
SARAH'S MOM
dialogue.context: The PAN continues, revealing an overturned chair.
dialogue.utterance: I got it.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: The PAN comes to a table. Smashed plates. Spilled coffee. A spatter of blood. A phone. It follows the phone cord onto Terminator in CLOSE-UP as he continues in a perfect simulation of her mother's voice...
dialogue.utterance: Okay, I've gotta go. I'm sorry I can't tell you very much now, Mom. I love you.
dialogue.speaker: TERMINATOR
dialogue.utterance: I love you too, sweetheart.

dialogue.speaker: FULL SHOT
dialogue.utterance: Sarah looks through Reese's haul.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Mmm. What's for dinner?
dialogue.utterance: Let's see. Corn syrup. Ammonia. Moth balls...
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: There are also boxes of shotgun shells, road flares, tape, scissors, pans, a strainer and many other odd utensils, substances, chemicals.
dialogue.utterance: Plastique.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: What's that?
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: Sarah looks a bit stricken as she contemplates the evening ahead.
dialogue.utterance: Nitroglycerin, basically. Bit more stable. I learned howto make it when I was a kid.

dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Make sure there's none on the threads, like this. Now screw the end-cap on...very gently.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: You must have had a fun child- hood.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: That's good. Now, seven more like that while I make fuses.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: I was thinking, there's so much I've got to show you when we get through this. It's mind boggling, the pos- sibilities...Disneyland, the beach, movies...matinees with popcorn and foot-long hot dogs...
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Hot dogs?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: I want to buy you a hot dog so bad,Kyle...all the things you've never seen and done. You're here, but wherever you go, and whatever you touch, you bring the war with you.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: My whole life has been combat.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: I want it to be over for you.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Not possible.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Reese looks up and finally catches her gaze. He reaches out for her hand and it seems he may be taking it to comfort her. But he turns her wrist to read her watch.
dialogue.utterance: I want it to be over for me too. I feel like I slipped over some invisible line, that I'm in your world now. Everything's the same, but I see it differently. It's like, there's you and me, and him...but nobody else can understand or help or even touch us.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: We'll head out at 0200. That gives you four hours to sleep if you want. I'll finish.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: He'll find us, won't he?
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Probably. Sarah, if I get zeroed...
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Don't say that.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: If I do, you have to get away, disappear without a trace. Different country, different name, everything. In case they send another one.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: It'll never be over, will it? Look at me, I'm shaking. Some legend, huh? You must be pretty disappointed.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: Several beats before Sarah speaks again. Her eyes seem luminous in the dark.
dialogue.utterance: No. I'm not.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: Kyle, the women in your time...what were they like?
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Good fighters.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Was there someone special?
dialogue.utterance: That's not what I meant.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Someone?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: A girl. You know.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: He looks away, outside the window
dialogue.utterance: No. Never.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Sarah studies him for a moment. She's sitting slightly behind him and she puts her hands on his shoulders and back, tracing the lines of his scars with her fingertips.
dialogue.utterance: I'm sorry.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: So much pain.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: You disconnect it.
dialogue.utterance: Pain can be controlled.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: And so you feel nothing.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: It's better that way.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Reese takes a long, slow breath before he answers, and when he does his voice has a new quality, an unfamiliar tenderness.
dialogue.utterance: Oh, Kyle.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: He closes his eyes, reaches toward her. His fingertips trace the contour of her nose, chin, cheeks.
dialogue.utterance: John Connor gave me a picture of you once. I never knew why. It was very old. Torn. Faded. You were young, like you are now. You weren't smiling...just a little sad... I always wondered what you were thinking at that second.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: He opens his eyes, looking right at hers.
dialogue.utterance: I memorized every line, every curve...
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: Reese looks away.
dialogue.utterance: Sarah, I came across time for you. I love you. I always have. Sarah is quietly overwhelmed.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said...
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: She leans forward and kisses him. His face is frozen. A mask. She continues, tenderly. He begins to respond. The dam breaks and he holds her in a tight, trembling embrace, clinging to her like life itself. Kyle picks her up and carries her to the bed. She kisses his neck and chest, tracing his scars with her lips. He unbuttons her blouse very slowly. Sarah guides his powerful hands over her.
dialogue.utterance: Kyle...

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: I bet you're ticklish.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: Sarah's hand moves OUT OF FRAME. After a moment Reese looks down, puzzled.
dialogue.utterance: Ticklish?
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: What are you doing?
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Reese seems unperturbed. Finally he begins to squirm.
dialogue.utterance: You'll beg for mercy in a second.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: I don't think I like this.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Now Reese is becoming desperate. A grimace spreads across his face. It becomes a grin. Then he's laughing, trying to escape but she won't let him, and they collapse, laughing together. Sarah gazes at his grin, a glimpse of the Reese that might have been, in another life. A moment later the grin vanishes at the sound of dogs barking outside. Reese is off the bed in an instant, crouched tense, eyes alert. Feral as ever.
dialogue.utterance: You're not supposed to.
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Listen to the dogs.

dialogue.speaker: PARTNER
dialogue.context: They lock eyes for a moment.
dialogue.utterance: Don't stop.
dialogue.speaker: DRIVER.
dialogue.utterance: I have to, man.

dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.utterance: Sarah.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: She hugs him.
dialogue.utterance: We did it, Kyle. We got it.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: What are you doing?
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: Yells over the machines.
dialogue.utterance: Leave me here. Sarah crouches beside him. Grabs his shirt front.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: Reese's eyes refocus.
dialogue.utterance: I'm not leaving you anywhere you jerk. Haven't you figured it out? Kyle, John is our son.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: She pauses, then resumes in a commanding, military shout.
dialogue.utterance: There isn't going to be anybody else...I don't want anybody else. Listen to me!
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: They double back to escape the cul-de-sac. The Terminator steps in front of them, cutting them off.
dialogue.utterance: Come on!
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: He pushes Sarah roughly and she stumbles away. Kyle raises the pipe with his good arm as the Terminator advances.
dialogue.utterance: Run!
dialogue.speaker: REESE
dialogue.context: The cyborg swings at Reese
dialogue.utterance: Run, damn it! She hesitates, backing away.

dialogue.speaker: COP
dialogue.utterance: Look, I told you not to touch anything until we're done. You got that?
dialogue.speaker: MANAGER
dialogue.context: He stands and palms a small object to HIS ASSISTANT. They step around the corner.
dialogue.utterance: Sure thing, officer.
dialogue.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogue.utterance: What is it?
dialogue.speaker: MANAGER
dialogue.utterance: Microcomputer chassis. But I've never seen stuff like this anywhere.
dialogue.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogue.utterance: Weird. Jap stuff, maybe?
dialogue.speaker: MANAGER
dialogue.utterance: Keep it out of sight and get it down to R and D Monday, first thing.
dialogue.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogue.utterance: Good idea.

dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: COVER SHOT reveals Sarah as the wheel of a dusty landrover parked at the pump island of a tiny gas station. All of its signs are in hand-lettered Spanish. Beyond lies an expanse of scrub desert. The sky scowls with an impending storm. Sarah speaks quietly into a hand microphone as a dark- complected attendant laconically fills her tank. She cradles the cassette recorder in her lap, in the lee of her SWOLLEN BELLY. She looks to be about SIX MONTHS ALONG. Under her down vest she wears a leather shoulder holster and the butt of a .357 REVOLVER presses against her breast. She tugs the vest closed as the attendant glances her way. A German Shepherd sits in the back among taped boxes and suitcases.
dialogue.utterance: ...and the hardest thing is deciding what I should tell you and what not to. Well, anyway, I've got a while yet before you're old enough to understand the tapes. They're more for me at this point... to help get it all straight.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: CLICK. WHIR. Sarah jumps at a sound nearby, breaking her reverie. A small MEXICAN BOY has snapped her picture with a beat-up Polaroid camera. He holds it out to her, speaking rapid Spanish.
dialogue.utterance: Should I tell you about your father? That's a tough one. Will it change your decision to send him here...knowing? But if you don't send Kyle, you could never be. God, you can go crazy thinking about all this...I suppose I'll tell you...I owe him that. And maybe it'll be enough if you know that in the few hours we had together we loved a lifetime's worth...
dialogue.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogue.utterance: He says you are very beautiful, Senora, and he is ashamed to ask five American dollars for this picture, but if he does not, his father will beat him.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.context: The boy takes her four dollars and she watches the snapshot develop. It is a good photograph of her, the wind lightly ruffling her hair, expression thought- ful, slightly sad. We recognize it as the one Reese carried in 2029. She slips it into her short pocket.
dialogue.utterance: That's a pretty good hustle, kid. Four. Quatro.
dialogue.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogue.context: The boy yells something in Spanish as he runs off.
dialogue.utterance: Mil trescientos...fifteen dollars American. As she pays him, distant thunder rolls.
dialogue.speaker: SARAH
dialogue.utterance: What did he say?
dialogue.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogue.context: Sarah gazes at the thunderheads building up out over the desert. Heat lightning pulses in their depths.
dialogue.utterance: There is a storm coming in.
